TopicTitle: [It's finally here!] Apollo Replica "MUNBUG XII" Saturn V, CSM, Lander, Buggy

Articles.Content: Munbug has exactly the right amount of fuel for a free return transfer. Sounds like you need to practice your ascent, Munbug is designed for advanced players.
Mulbin, is your craft able to shut down the centre engine on stage 1 and 2 at 75% stage fuel remaining like Apollo did? I`m having trouble when I do.

I just put your lander on the Mun with no problems controlling it at all.

http://i950.photobucket.com/albums/ad343/Larry_M/KSP2014-03-1808-57-29-31.jpg

I just put your lander on the Mun with no problems controlling it at all.

http://i950.photobucket.com/albums/ad343/Larry_M/KSP2014-03-1808-57-29-31.jpg

Great....

Looking a little tight on fuel! Hopefully you can get into orbit with RCS... did you land using the technique show on the main post? Much more efficient than fighting gravity all the way down.

Great....

Looking a little tight on fuel! Hopefully you can get into orbit with RCS... did you land using the technique show on the main post? Much more efficient than fighting gravity all the way down.

Oh! I thought I had another fuel tank for the ascent. Yes, it will be tight if that is it for fuel. RCS, yes, I hope so...

And, yes, I used the technique in the video you posted. It seemed to make the landing much easier then what I have been doing in the past. But, as you can see by how much fuel I burned I need more practice, plus I was too high off the surface. I should have been closer like in your video. Thanks for posting that video.

Great looking lander!

Time to watch a few more tutorials.

Edited March 18, 2014 by Larrt_M
What mod did you have installed when you created that video to give you "Surface Information"? I could sure use a mod like that!
Its not my video, it was created by Kosmonot. The lander in the video is the old munbug lander... it's waaaaay too big for the rest of the craft.

What mod did you have installed when you created that video to give you "Surface Information"? I could sure use a mod like that!

I believe it may be MechJeb.
Oh, OK, thanks!

Its not my video, it was created by Kosmonot. The lander in the video is the old munbug lander... it's waaaaay too big for the rest of the craft.

I was referring to the Munbug XI Lander. The one I landed on the Mun. The one in the video may be too big but it still looks great also.

Edited March 18, 2014 by Larrt_M

I had a bit of a time getting the rover out. Every time I used the propulsion system, space bar or F6 it would flip the lander over on it's side. Probably something I was or was not doing correctly. The only success I had was to thrust the lander up a couple of feet and hit the F5 key. That worked fine! Then I moved that small thruster icon up with the parachutes.
Yeah, I wasn't entirely happy with the sepratron... It was a attempt to stop the rover getting stuck upside down. I think the next version will use a different system.
So, there will be another version. Nice! Maybe I will wait for it's release before attempting another Apollo Mun landing.
Not for a little while as life is hectic but eventually I'll finish the version with the interstage and ALSEP posted a few pages back.
Yeah, that looks fantastic! I can wait...
Are the new larger parts going to be used in the next version of munbug? They look like the right size for the second stage.
Yeah, I think I'll hold off until after the patch is out. Might be a lot less parts on the next munbug!

Yeah, I think I'll hold off until after the patch is out. Might be a lot less parts on the next munbug!

Oh yes! Im very excited about the part saving on Apollo craft!

So... after many hours of work, I finally get Munbug XII near to completion. Then KSP screws up with the VAB bug and all of my work is lost. Craft file corrupted, will make a fresh start again... maybe next month.

Was it the dreaded symmetry bug?

Yes this is very sad indeed. I had this happen so often that I now make two back-up saves.

The bug will bite soon and it will be easy this time. Good luck Mulbin!

MJ

Hey Mulbin, it's a longshot, but have you tried using the utility at the bottom of this page: http://www.kerbaltekaerospace.com/?page=craftkitchen ?

I haven't tested it, but it claims to be able to fix craft files with the symmetry bug. There's nothing to lose, right?
All waiting for a new 3rd stage using the new extra large parts!
